data.title: Sustainable Innovation & Technology
data.meta_description: Explore how Google is driving sustainable innovation through technology to collectively create a greater sustainable impact for all.
data.text:
Pursuing net-zero emissions through technology and innovation

We use energy to power our products and to run our operations, including our data centers and offices. For our third decade of climate action, weâre pursuing net-zero emissions across our operations and value chain by 2030.7 This is supported by our ambitious clean energy goal to operate our data centers and office campuses on 24/7 carbon-free energy, such as solar and wind.8

Learn More

How weâre helping everyone benefit from the transition to clean energy

A sustainable future means decarbonizing the electricity grid for everyone.

Aiming to get closer to a carbon-free future: Our largest offshore wind projects to date

With our latest power purchase agreements, weâre adding over 700 megawatts of clean energy capacity to European grids.

A new initiative with Microsoft and Nucor to accelerate advanced clean electricity technologies

Weâre developing a new demand aggregation model to help bring first-of-its-kind commercial projects to the market.

The Corporate Role in Accelerating Advanced Clean Electricity Technologies

How companies can play a catalytic role by directing some of their clean energy purchases and investments to support the commercialization of these technologies.

Advancing water stewardship

We use water to help cool our data centers, and in our offices around the world. We strive to be responsible stewards of every resource we use, including water.

We aim to replenish 120% of the freshwater8 volume we consume, on average, across our offices and data centers by 2030, and to help restore and improve the quality of water and health of ecosystems in the communities where we operate.

Learn more

Learn about freshwater on World Water Day

A new âFreshwaterâ hub has launched to explore some of the ways we can take action to preserve the most important resource for life on our blue planet.

How weâre supporting our commitment to water stewardship

A look at four innovative initiatives that support water security in communities where we operate.

Discover the link between climate change and freshwater availability

Making up only 3.5% of Earthâs total water volume, freshwater is increasingly impacted by human activity, from climate change to unsustainable over-use.

Our commitment to climate-conscious data center cooling

We take a climate-conscious approach to cooling our data centers as we continue to deliver on our commitments to champion responsible water use and operate on 24/7 carbon-free energy9 by 2030.

Accelerating a circular economy

Our work toward a more circular economy cuts across all our core business operations including our data centers, workplaces, and consumer hardware products, and spans the entire value chain from safer chemistry and manufacturing waste to electronic waste recycling and eliminating single-use plastics.

We aim to maximize the reuse of finite resources across our operations, products, and supply chains and enable others to do the same.

Learn more

7 ways weâre helping to reduce plastic pollution

Weâre making it easier to find recycling locations, shop for pre-owned items, create efficient waste management processes, and more.

How Recykal aims to build Asiaâs largest circular economy marketplace using Google AI

Recykalâs 500-strong team is rethinking Indiaâs recycling ecosystem. Powered by Google AI, the startup says it has created the fastest-growing waste commerce marketplace in Asia.

Tackling single-use plastics: How 5 innovative companies rise to the challenge

The Single-Use Plastics Challengeâhosted in collaboration with Canteen and other food service partnersâgave food companies with packaging that is free of single-use plastic the opportunity to test their solutions in Googleâs U.S.-based cafÃ©s and kitchens.

Google & Repairability

Learn about Googleâs viewpoint on Right to Repair legislation, a short description of Googleâs current repair capacities, and how it can advance Googleâs overall sustainability efforts.
